content.question: If <math alttext="the integral from, negative 1 to 3, of, open parenthesis, 2 times g of x, plus 4, close parenthesis, d x, equals 22" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>22</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="the integral from, 10 to negative 1, of, g of x, d x, equals 12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></math>, then <math alttext="the integral from, 3 to 10, of, g of x, d x, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
